page.title: 01BROADWAY AND WILLERSEY HILL
page.content: This block is on the west slopes of the{Cotswold Escarpment}where the land falls steeply to the{Vale of Evesham below. The A44 road crosses the block from North-West to South-East through the tourist village of{Broadway}and then in a series of steep twists and turns it ascends Fish Hill to the Fish Inn 240 metres above the village. It is a rural area of great natural beauty enhanced by the Cotswold stone villages of{Broadway, Saintbury}and {Willersey} The slopes of the hills are mainly grassland with deciduous tree cover and sheep grazing. In the Vale below the land is farmed. There are apple and plum orchards and a variety of market garden crops are grown. The area is criss-crossed with public footpaths and is popular with walkers and tourists.
